intro: Tessaria integrifolia var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf tessaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, entire leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a fibrous root system and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
